verses.verse: For the director.[b] According to “The Deer of the Dawn.” A psalm of David.
[c]My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why have you paid no heed to my call for help, to my cries of anguish?
O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer, by night, but I am afforded no relief.[d]
Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One; you are the praise of Israel.
Our ancestors placed their trust in you; they trusted, and you gave them deliverance.
They cried out to you and were saved, they trusted in you and were not put to shame.
But I am a worm and not human,[e] scorned by people and despised by my kinsmen.
All who see me jeer at me; they sneer in mockery and toss their heads:[f]
“He relied on the LORD; let the LORD set him free. Let the LORD deliver him, if he loves him.”[g]
[h]Yet you brought me out of the womb and made me feel secure upon my mother’s breast.
I was entrusted to your care at my birth; from my mother’s womb, you have been my God.
Do not remain aloof from me, for trouble is near and no one can help me.
[i]Many bulls[j] are encircling me; fierce bulls of Bashan are closing in on me.
They open wide their mouths against me like ravening and roaring lions.
My strength is trickling away like water, and all my bones are dislocated. My heart[k] has turned to wax and melts within me.
My mouth is as dry as clayware, and my tongue sticks to my jaw;[l] you have laid me down in the dust of death.
A pack of dogs surrounds me; a band of evildoers is closing in on me. They have pierced my hands and my feet;[m]
I can count all my bones.[n] They stare at me and gloat;
they divide my garments among them, and for my clothing they cast lots.[o]
[p]But you, O LORD, do not remain aloof from me. O my Strength, come quickly to my aid.
Deliver my soul from the sword, my precious life from the grasp of the dogs.
Save me[q] from the lion’s mouth and from the horns of wild oxen.
[r]I will proclaim your name to my family; in the midst of the assembly I will praise you:[s]
“You who fear the LORD, praise him. All you descendants of Jacob,[t] give him glory. Revere him, all you descendants of Israel.
For he has not scorned or disregarded the wretched man in his suffering; he has not hidden his face[u] from him but has heeded his call for help.”
I will offer my praise to you in the great assembly; in the presence of those who fear him, I will fulfill my vows.[v]
[w]The poor[x] will eat and be filled; those who seek the LORD will praise him: “May your hearts live forever.”
All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD. All the families of the nations will bow low before him.
For kingly power belongs to the LORD; he is the ruler of all the nations.
All those who prosper on the earth will bow down before him; all those who lie in the grave will kneel in homage.
[y]But I will live for the LORD, and my descendants will serve him.
